other_tests.findings: Histologic sections demonstrated psoriasiform hyperplasia of the epidermis with overlying parakeratosis. Scattered neutrophils were seen within the stratum corneum. Mild lymphocytic infiltrate was present in the papillary dermis.
Revealed a 5-cm mass in the tail of the pancreas.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Mass surgically removed; no recurrence of the tumor has been reported for 6 months.

other_tests.findings: Initial level of 744 pg/mL; follow-up level increased to 2570 pg/mL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased glucagon levels were noted over time.
